intro: Asyneuma scoparium, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness. Asyneuma scoparium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
